results.title: Bugsy Malone
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Puttnam, Alan Marshall and Goodtimes Enterprises
results.brief_description: A mad gangster musical set in the New York of the 1920s, a world of would-be hoodlums, show girls and dreamers. But there are no adults, only children. Bugsy, Blousey, Tallulah, Fat Sam, Fizzy, Leroy and Loney are some of the characters involved in a bitter gang war for possession of the dreaded “spurge gun”. Stars a very young Jodie Foster.

results.title: WHO: The kids are alright
results.creator_credit: Jeff Stein, Tony Klinger, Bill Curbishley and BMG Music
results.brief_description: Features live performances of the Who’s most celebrated hits from “My generation” to the sophistication of the rock opera “Tommy”. Along with the guitar-smashing exuberance of the group’s stage performances, director Jeff Stein has assembled a series of interviews which reflect the collective and individual nature of the band.

results.title: Man in the white suit
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A scientist, played by Alec Guinnes, invents a fabric that never gets dirty and never wears out. Unions and management are equally perturbed by this and endeavour to prevent its manufacture. Academy Award nomination for scripting.

results.title: Clara Gibbings
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This production was adapted from the play of the same name and remained basically a filmed stage play. Dorothy Brunton plays Clara Gibbings, the proprietor of a London pub, who discovers that she is the legitimate but abandoned daughter of the Earl of Dunmoor. She launches herself into high society but soon grows disillusioned and decides to return to the fresh air of her own class. A young aristocrat, Errol, has meanwhile learnt to respect Clara and to see his own decadent life in a new light. Impulsively he proposes marriage and they depart for Australia.

results.title: Diggers
results.creator_credit: Frank Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This was the first feature film of the Melbourne enterprise Efftee Films and was adapted for the screen by Pat Hanna from three sketches from his popular Diggers stage show, which featured two Australian cobbers serving in the AIF in France in 1918. The first episode presents the two friends in their attempts to steal rum from a British Army Store; the second episode shows them relaxing in a French cafe while a fellow digger romances with the waitress; the final episode finds the diggers in hospital feigning illness to escape active duty. Cast includes Pat Hanna and George Moon.

results.title: Burden of dreams
results.brief_description: A documentary by Les Blank which provides a detailed look at the making of the ill-starred five year production of Werner Herzog’s feature film ‘Fitzcarraldo’. Set in the jungle of Peru ‘Fitzcarraldo’ is the story of an opera mad genius (played by Klaus Kinski) who will stop at nothing to achieve his ideal of building an opera house in the middle of the jungle. In many ways the narrative of Fitzcarraldo parallels Herzog’s production experiences. Despite one setback after another in filming: from monsoonal floods to warring native tribespeople, Herzog persisted with his dream until the film was complete. Not a conventional ‘behind-the-scenes’ promotional documentary, but a film which raises the question about the pursuit of art and what it can entail.

results.title: The Siege of Pinchgut
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Made in Australia by Ealing Studios, this film is concerned with the escape from prison of a man who claims he has been unjustly incarcerated. He escapes and lands on Pinchgut Island in Sydney Harbour, occupies a disused arsenal and defies a police seige by taking the caretaker and his family hostage. Stars Aldo Ray and Heather Sears with Richard Vernon, Grant Taylor and Kenneth Warren. Screenplay by Harry Watt and Jon Cleary.

results.title: Looks and smiles
results.creator_credit: Ken Loach, Irving Teitelbaum, Kestrel Films (Australia) and Black Lion Films
results.brief_description: This film by Ken Loach, the Director of “Cathy come home”, “Family life and “Kes”, takes a bleak but compassionate look at working-class life in contemporary Britain. It is set in Industrialized Sheffield and while not an attack on the system, the film implicity condemns the system’s failure to cope with economic fluctuations. Script by Barry Hines.

results.title: The Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description: This full length version of one of the most important films in the history of silent cinema portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. It brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.
